subject: Personal Finance
title: The Stock Market Explained
description: A short lesson to help you apply The Stock Market Explained.

hook.text: The stock market is a place where nervous people sell to greedy people and vice versa. Every day.

buildup.text: Buying stock means buying a tiny ownership share of a company. You own a sliver of its future profits.

discovery.text: Stock prices move based on expected future earnings, not past performance. Markets are forward-looking.

twist.text: Over 80% of daily stock trading is done by algorithms, not humans. Robots set most prices now.

climax.text: Despite daily chaos, the stock market has averaged about 10% annual returns over a century.

punchline.text: Stocks: chaotic daily, reliable over decades.

quiz.question: What does buying stock represent?
options: Owning a small share of a company
